How to Install pkgdiff on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • pkgdiff

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install pkgdiff on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing pkgdiff on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall pkgdiff in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install pkgdiff, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install pkgdiff Using apt

To install pkgdiff in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install pkgdiff using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install pkgdiff

The installation of pkgdiff might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install pkgdiff Using apt-get

To install pkgdiff using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install pkgdiff.

sudo apt-get -y install pkgdiff

Install pkgdiff Using Synaptic

To install pkgdiff using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install pkgdiff on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for pkgdiff. This will display the pkgdiff package in the package window, now to install pkgdiff, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the pkgdiff package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of pkgdiff.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install pkgdiff Using aptitude

To install pkgdiff on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of pkgdiff.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install pkgdiff using the command aptitude install pkgdiff.

sudo aptitude -y install pkgdiff

How to Upgrade pkgdiff on debian

If you want to upgrade the pkgdiff package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade pkgdiff using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade pkgdiff to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade pkgdiff.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade pkgdiff sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade pkgdiff

Upgrade pkgdiff using Aptitude

To upgrade pkgdiff using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade pkgdiff.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade pkgdiff

Upgrade pkgdiff using Synaptic

To upgrade pkgdiff using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for pkgdiff, now right-click pkgdiff, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade pkgdiff just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall pkgdiff on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall pkgdiff from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just pkgdiff, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove pkgdiff

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of pkgdiff

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of pkgdiff you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge pkgdiff

Remove pkgdiff using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall pkgdiff using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for pkgdiff, right-click the pkgdiff package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall pkgdiff click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install pkgdiff on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade pkgdiff using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of pkgdiff then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
